articles.title: China wants US to relax AI chip-export controls for trade deal, FT reports
articles.summary: China wants the United States to ease export controls on chips critical for artificial intelligence as part of a trade deal before a possible summit between Presidents Donald Trump and Xi Jinping, the Financial Times reported on Sunday.

articles.title: China wants US to relax chip-export controls as part of trade deal, FT reports
articles.summary: China wants the United States to ease export controls on a critical component for artificial intelligence chips as part of a trade deal ahead of a possible summit between U.S. President Donald Trump and Chinese President Xi Jinping, the Financial Times reported on Sunday.
articles.translated_title: China wants US to relax chip-export controls as part of trade deal, FT reports

articles.title: Traders Are Fleeing Stocks Feared to Be Under Threat From AI
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence‚Äôs imprint on US financial markets is unmistakable. Nvidia Corp. is the most valuable company in the world at nearly $4.5 trillion. Startups from OpenAI to Anthropic have raised tens of billions of dollars.

articles.title: AI Boom, Entry-Level Bust: Why College Grads Are Struggling to Land Jobs
articles.summary: As artificial intelligence transforms the job market, recent college graduates are finding it harder to land entry-level roles in competitive fields like tech and finance ‚Äî even with strong r√©sum√©s and top internships. Economists point to a surge in AI adoption, along with a slowdown in post-pandemic hiring, as key factors driving unemployment among college grads above the national average. Financial leaders like Centerview Partners‚Äô Blair Effron warn that although the AI revolution will boost long-term productivity, short-term impacts on employment will be swift and dramatic. (Source: Bloomberg)
